fields.request: Manual QA: Ensure install --repair stops running services to avoid database locks
fields.request_details:
1. Identify the deployment service name (for example `arthexis`) from `locks/service.lck` or the `--service` flag.
2. Start the existing service with `sudo systemctl start ${SERVICE}` and confirm it is active with `systemctl is-active ${SERVICE}`. If celery units exist, start them as well so they are running.
3. From the deployment root, run `./install.sh --repair --service ${SERVICE}`.
4. Watch the output for the "Stopping" messages and confirm no `database is locked` errors occur during migrations.
5. After the script finishes, verify `systemctl is-active ${SERVICE}` returns `active` and any celery units are running again, confirming the repair restarted the stack successfully.
